snippet: With no definitive results from a messy election, Italy can’t push through the kind of radical changes it needs to grow its economy.
abstract: Editorial warns lack of definitive results in Italy's election means it cannot push through changes it needs to grow its economy; notes European leaders who pressured former Prime Min Mario Monti's government to tighten screws of austerity bear some responsibility for election result and must now help Italy seek democratic way out of parliamentary gridlock.
lead_paragraph: With no definitive results from a messy election, Italy can’t push through the kind of radical changes it needs to grow its economy.

headline.seo: Italy, in Search of a Government
headline.main: Italy, in Search of a Government
headline.print_headline: Italy, in Search of a Government
